explanations.summary: Hormone-regulated renal transports: (1) K+ secretion - aldosterone (collecting duct), (2) Na+ reabsorption - ANH inhibits it (collecting duct), (3) Ca2+ reabsorption - PTH (distal tubule). NOT: vasopressin on thick ascending limb Na+, aldosterone on proximal tubule.

whyCorrect.b: Aldosterone increases K+ secretion in collecting duct principal cells via ENaC and ROMK channels.
whyCorrect.d: ANH (ANP) INHIBITS Na+ reabsorption in collecting duct (opposes aldosterone).
whyCorrect.e: PTH increases Ca2+ reabsorption in distal tubule via TRPV5 channels.

whyIncorrect.a: Vasopressin acts on collecting duct water permeability, not thick ascending limb Na+.
whyIncorrect.c: Aldosterone acts on collecting duct, NOT proximal tubule.
whyIncorrect.f: Aldosterone increases K+ SECRETION, not reabsorption.

explanations.topicReference: Topic 81: Hormone Regulation of Renal Transport
